title.en: English for Students of Medicine (100% Web-Based), Level B2 > C1
title.et: Erialane inglise keel arstiteaduse üliõpilastele (100% e-õpe), tase B2 > C1

Tartu linn,

description.en:
The course introduces subject-specific vocabulary related to the following topics:
1 Digestive system
2 Cardiovascular system
3 Respiratory system
4 Viral infections, mRNA vaccines
5 Mental health, anxiety disorders
description.et:
Kursusel käsitletakse järgnevaid teemasid:
1 Seedeelundkond
2 Südameveresoonkond
3 Hingamiselundkond
4 Viirushaigused, mRNA vaktsiinid
5 Vaimne tervis, ärevushäired

objectives.en: The main aim of the course is to expand students' subject-specific vocabulary through a wide variety of tasks:
objectives.et: Kursuse üldeesmärgiks on arendada erialast sõnavara mitmesuguste tegevuste kaudu:

objectives.en: 1 reading subject-specific texts and doing after-reading tasks,
objectives.et: 1 erialaste tekstide lugemine ja lugemisjärgsete harjutuste tegemine,

objectives.en: 2 watching subject-specific videos and doing after-watching tasks,
objectives.et: 2 erialase videomaterjali vaatamine ning vaatamisjärgsete harjutuste tegemine,

objectives.en: 3 doing different interactive exercises to consolidate the subject-specific vocabulary.
objectives.et: 3 mitmesuguste interaktiivsete sõnavaraharjtuste tegemine erialse sõnavara kinnistamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: On completion of the course, the students
will have expanded their general academic and subject-specific vocabulary,
learning_outcomes.et: on laiendanud oma üldakadeemilist ja erialast sõnavara,

learning_outcomes.en: will be able to better understand and analyze subject-specific texts.

grade_preconditions.et:
1 ACTIVE participation in the e-study (doing weekly tasks).
2 Passing 12 weekly self-assessment tests . Weekly self-assessment tests are open on Fridays from 13:00 - 13:20 (max score 20, pass score 14 (70%), two attempts). The tests have to be taken at the scheduled time!
3 Passing 3 end-of-the module tests with the minimum score of 70% (max score 60, pass score 42, two attempts).

grade_evaluation.et:
To get a PASS for the course you need to
*	actively participate in the e-study,
*	pass 12 weekly self-assessment tests,
*	pass 3 end-of the-module tests with the minimum score of 70%.

debt_elimination.et: By prior arrangement with the teacher.

description.et: Week 1 - Introduction to the course. Lead-in vocabulary exercises. Practice self-assessment test.
Week 2 - Vocabulary related to the digestive system. The dangers of visceral fat. Self-assessment test.
Week 3 - The effects of intermittent fasting on health. Self-assessment test.
Week 4 - Basic word analysis - important medical roots and prefixes. Self-assessment test.
Week 6 - Vocabulary related to the cardiovascular system. Sudden cardiac death. Self-assessment test.
Week 7 - Disease and disorder terms of the CVS. Heart failure. Self-assessment test.
Week 8 - The importance of exercise in cardiovascular health. Self-assessment test.
Week 9 - Basic word analysis - medical suffixes, plural forms. Self-assessment test.
Week 11 - Vocabulary related to the respiratory system. Self-assessment test.
Week 12 - Disease and disorder terms of the respiratory system. Lung cancer. Self-assessment test.

Week 13 - Viruses and vaccines. mRNA vaccines. How the coronavirus attacks the lungs. Self-assessment 
test.
Week 14 - Anxiety disorders - general considerations, clinical findings, treatment and prognosis. Self-assessment test.
